alert.note: Alert for Clay; Coosa; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 8:59AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Tallapoosa, northeastern Coosa and southern Clay Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 858 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stewartville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alexander City, Goodwater, Kellyton, Weogufka, Stewartville, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Goldville, Hillabee Creek, Hanover, Bradford, Bentleyville, Northern Lake Martin, Parkdale, Hatchet, Crewsville, Daviston, Cleveland Crossroads, Hollins and Horseshoe Bend National Military Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
